abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile focuses on
            overcoming the odds in Burkina Faso. Burkina remained one of
            the poorest countries in the world. Along with education and
            health challenges, energy crisis and fluctuating commodity
            prices resulted in the increased numbers of poor people
            living below poverty. Accelerated Growth and Sustainable
            Development Project supported sustained policy reform in
            Burkina’s transition towards a market economy through
            financial assistance and strategic advice. It has helped
            forge a new aid compact based on poverty reduction
            strategies, debt relief, better-harmonized aid and
            government leadership. The Bank has worked to achieve
            tangible results in multiple sectors, promoting growth
            through economic transformation, minimizing economic
            vulnerability and improving social service delivery.
